commander.name: Pietro Zaglio
commander.notes: Commanded Pavia from May 24, 1939 through April 20, 1941

command.headquarters_location: Sabratha-Surman sector, Libya (coastal defense west of Tripoli)

SPA AS.37 Sahariano.notes: AS-type desert vehicle for coastal operations

65/17 Mod. 13.notes: 4 per infantry regiment, support weapons companies

supply_logistics.supply_status: Adequate for coastal defense, positioned for offensive into Egypt. Primary constraint: 1800km supply line from Tripoli via coastal Via Balbia. Forward supply dumps established at Bardia and Tobruk. Water and fuel critical limitations for sustained offensive operations beyond Sidi Barrani.

weather_environment.season_quarter: 1940-Q3 (July-September): Late summer, hot conditions, low rainfall
weather_environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (Sabratha-Surman sector west of Tripoli)

tactical_doctrine.role: Coastal defense Sabratha-Surman sector, positioned for Italian invasion of Egypt (September 13, 1940, Operation E). Advanced to Sidi Barrani.
special_capabilities: Truck-moveable (autotrasportabile) for rapid repositioning along Via Balbia
Desert-adapted with specialized vehicles (SPA AS.37 Sahariano)
Limited mechanization compared to full motorized divisions
L3/35 tankette battalion provides mobile reconnaissance and infantry support
known_issues: Insufficient motor transport for simultaneous movement of entire division
Dependent on corps-level transport assets for sustained mobility
Limited anti-tank capability (only 8x 47mm guns) vulnerable to British Matilda tanks
Weak anti-aircraft defense (only 4x 20mm guns) vulnerable to RAF attacks
Binary structure reduces combat power compared to pre-1939 ternary divisions (7,500 vs 13,000 men)
Water supply critical constraint for operations beyond 180km from coastal dumps
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Equipped with SPA AS.37 Sahariano desert vehicles, increased water transport capacity (4L/person/day allocation), light uniform and equipment modifications for coastal desert operations, sand-colored camouflage schemes

validation.notes: CRITICAL CORRECTION: User requested '27ª Divisione Pavia' but historical records confirm this is the 17th Infantry Division 'Pavia'. The 27th Division was 'Brescia' (separate unit). Confusion arises from Pavia's subordinate 27th Infantry Regiment. Personnel totals calculated from TM 30-420 standard binary autotrasportabile division organization (~7,500 men). Vehicle counts based on autotrasportabile division tables and Italian motor transport allocations 1940-Q3. Artillery confirmed from multiple sources (26th Artillery Regiment: 12x 100/17, 24x 75/27 standard for binary division). Tank battalion composition from standard L3/35 battalion TO&E (12 tankettes). Division participated in Italian invasion of Egypt September 13, 1940 (Operation E) advancing to Sidi Barrani where it remained in static defense until destroyed in Operation Compass December 1940. Commander Pietro Zaglio confirmed from May 24, 1939 through April 20, 1941. Schema v3.1.0 includes required supply_logistics and weather_environment sections for scenario generation.
